intro: Biondia laxa, commonly known as the slender biondia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona. Biondia laxa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
